thread.section_title: Australian Business & World Finance News - Yahoo!7 Finance
thread.title: $A boosted by improved business conditions

title: $A boosted by improved business conditions
text:
Tue, Sep 8, 2015, 5:33 PM AEST - Australia Markets closed $A boosted by improved business conditions AAP – 5 minutes ago Print 
The Australian dollar has been lifted by a survey showing the strongest business conditions in 10 months. 
At 1700 AEST on Tuesday, the local unit was trading at 69.73 US cents, up from 69.33 cents on Monday. 
The overnight session was subdued due to a public holiday in the US, and the currency picked up from 1130 AEST when National Australia Bank's monthly business survey was released. 
It showed a significant improvement in business conditions, particularly trading volumes and profitability, but also a drop in business confidence. 
"The NAB business survey result for August was surprisingly firm," JP Morgan FX strategists said. 
"The confidence index shed three points ... but the more important conditions index jumped from 6 to 11, its strongest level of the year, and the major subcomponents were also perky." 
The Australian dollar dipped slightly on the release later in the day of weaker than expected August trade data from China, most notably a sharp fall in imports from a year ago. 
But that only had a brief impact, with the currency again rising in the final hour of local trade. 
At 1700 AEST, the Australian dollar was at 82.58 Japanese yen, down from Monday's close of 82.72 yen, and at 62.25 euro cents, up from 62.24 euro cents. 
The bond market was relatively steady after a subdued session following the US public holiday. 
At 1630 AEST on Tuesday, the September 2015 10-year bond futures contract was trading at 97.305 (implying a yield of 2.695 per cent), unchanged from Monday. 
The September 2015 three-year bond futures contract was at 98.200 (1.800 per cent), down from 98.210 (1.790 per cent). @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Majority disapprove of Hockey as treasurer AAP
